characters.name: Hyakkimaru
characters.description: Hyakkimaru is the central character of Tezuka's best-known samurai story, Dororo. A powerful warrior, Hyakkimaru is traveling on a long quest to retrieve 48 parts of his body which were sold to demons by his father at his birth. This is a very dramatic adventure series, with a great variety of unusual mythological creatures and demons, as well as bandits and other fierce foes. Gradually the grim experiences of his travels make Hyakkimaru more and more distant and grim, so as he recovers more and more of his human body he becomes at the same time less and less human.

characters.name: Dororo
characters.description:
~!__Gender__: Female!~

After seeing his swordsmanship, Dororo decides to follow Hyakkimaru. Dororo was a thief before meeting Hyakkimaru.

~!Dororo's bandit father Hibukuro was wounded by a samurai official and later died. Her mother froze to death while fleeing in the snow, but before she died she drew a map on Dororo's back to locate money hidden by her father at Bone Cape.

Hyakkimaru learns that Dororo is female with the latter continuously insisting she is a boy, though this is because her parents raised her as one.!~

characters.name: Biwamaru
characters.description:
Biwamaru (sometimes Biwa Maru) is a blind, itinerant acupuncture doctor, who wanders around Japan curing all sorts of ailments with miraculous speed. He is extremely disheveled in appearance, dressed in rags and walking with a twisted stick as a cane, and a rough bundle on his back. Biwamaru is effective, like Black Jack, an unlicensed doctor, since his practices are considered to be quackery by the medical establishment, while Biwamaru considers it barbaric to cut open a patient to cure them. This, as with Dr. Kiriko, Biwamaru is another nemesis who is too similar to Black Jack for the two to forgive their differences. Biwamaru also features in Tezuka’s best-known samurai manga, Dororo.

~!When Biwamaru came to Black Jack's town in issue #126 'The Blind Doctor of Acupuncture,' (6/7/1976) it was hatred at first sight, as each dismissed the other as a quack, though neither was able to deny the effectiveness of the other’s treatments. To make matters worse, Biwamaru charges nothing for his services, in contrast with Black Jack's outrageous fees, leading to criticism of Black Jack by the local community. Their interaction here effectively degenerated into each attempting repeatedly to prove that the other was a quack, and generally failing, though teaching each other bitter lessons about the limitations of their methods.

The two met again not long afterwards in issue #141, 'Death of Hyojisai' (The Master Forger, Two People at the Thermal Bath) when they met at a hot spring and discovered that both of them, out of dedication to their work, made regular pilgrimages to see the same world-famous master forger, who made scalpels for the one and needles for the other. On discovering that the forger was sick, the two compete to cure him, while the forger, Hyojisai, uses his own illness to teach the two that, skilled as they are, both are powerless in the face of fate. It is a bitter experience for both of them. The trailer for the upcoming Two Dark Doctors movie indicates that the film will include scenes from this issue.!~

Notably, Biwamaru also appeared in Dororo as a blind musician and masters-swordsman. The crippled samurai Hyakkumaru, widely acknowledged as a prototype of Black Jack, encountered Biwamaru here and became his student in swordfighting, an interesting reversal of his role in Black Jack.

(Source: tezukainenglish.com)

characters.name: Kagemitsu Daigo
characters.description:
Daigo was the lord of Ishikawa domain which was ravaged by floods and starvation due to poor harvest. He made a deal with a group of 48 devils (12 in 2019 version) in order to save his domain and to aggrandise his power. He promises each devil a body part from his unborn child in exchange for the power to take over the land.

~!Towards the end of episode 24, while dying from the side effects of having made a pact with the demons, he is seen regretting having sold his son to the demons and realises that it was the will of Hyakkimaru to live on that the demons craved for and that perhaps, if he had succeeded his reign, the prosperity that he desired would have been fulfilled.!~

characters.name: Narrator
characters.description:
This character page is set to represent and list all narrators, which haven't been given a visual representation of themselves in their respective work. 

Please add other narrator characters, which were given a visual representation of themselves, separately from this narrator page.

characters.name: Nuinokata
characters.description: Daigo's wife, mother of Hyakkimaru and Tahoumaru.

characters.name: Jukai
characters.description: A skilled doctor and surgeon who used healing magic and alchemical methods to give the child who became Hyakkimaru prostheses crafted from the remains of children who had died in the war.

characters.name: Tahoumaru Daigo
characters.description: Brother of Hyakkimaru and the second son (successor) of  Kagemitsu Daigo. Born after Hyakkimaru was abandoned.

characters.name: Mio
characters.description: Mio is a young girl who lived in an abandoned temple with orphans who lost their parents in the war. She is kind and caring as she tends to put others in priority instead of herself.

characters.name: Osushi Niki
characters.description: She is Tanosuke's younger sister and a girl who cares deeply for her brother. She begs Hyakkimaru to spare Tanosuke's life, but after her brother dies, she directs her resentment toward Hyakkimaru and drives him out of the village. In contrast, she bids Dororo a kind farewell, telling him to take care of himself.

characters.name: Itachi
characters.description: A bandit who betrayed Dororo's father Hibukuro and sided with the authorities.

characters.name: Ojiya
characters.description: She is a bandit along with her husband, Hibukuro. She is the mother of Dororo.

characters.name: Hibukuro
characters.description: He is the leader of a bandit clan that is devoted into raiding samurai forts. He is the father of Dororo

characters.name: Saru
characters.description: He is a young boy, whose parents died when he was little. He used to live in the mountains all alone​ before he met a kind woman named Oume who took him in.

characters.name: Souryo
characters.description: His real name is unknown. He is a monk/priest who was in the temple Hall of Hell​ before Kagemitsu Daigo came and killed him.
